name: Framework
description: Universal framework compatibility layer that provides consistent access to player data, jobs, and framework-specific functions across QB-Core, ESX, QBox, and custom frameworks. This is the foundation module that enables cross-framework development.
note: This is a core module that automatically detects and adapts to your server's framework. All functions are framework-agnostic and return consistent data formats regardless of the underlying framework.

clientFunctions.name: GetFrameworkName

returns.description: The name of the detected framework ('qb-core', 'qbx_core', 'es_extended')

clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
local frameworkName = Bridge.Framework.GetFrameworkName()
print('Using framework:', frameworkName)

clientFunctions.name: GetPlayerData

returns.description: Player data in framework's native format

clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
local playerData = Bridge.Framework.GetPlayerData()
print('Player name:', playerData.charinfo.firstname)
clientFunctions.note: Returns raw framework data - prefer using specific getter functions for consistency

clientFunctions.name: GetFrameworkJobs

returns.description: Array of job objects with name, label, and grades

clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
local jobs = Bridge.Framework.GetFrameworkJobs()
for _, job in pairs(jobs) do
    print('Job:', job.name, job.label)
end

clientFunctions.name: GetPlayerDob
clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
local dob = Bridge.Framework.GetPlayerDob()
print('Player DOB:', dob)

clientFunctions.name: GetPlayerMetaData
clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
local stress = Bridge.Framework.GetPlayerMetaData('stress')
print('Player stress level:', stress)

clientFunctions.name: GetPlayerIdentifier
clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
local identifier = Bridge.Framework.GetPlayerIdentifier()
print('Player ID:', identifier)

clientFunctions.name: GetPlayerName
clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
local firstName, lastName = Bridge.Framework.GetPlayerName()
print('Player name:', firstName, lastName)

clientFunctions.name: GetPlayerJob

returns.description: Job name, label, grade name, grade level

clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
local jobName, jobLabel, gradeName, gradeLevel = Bridge.Framework.GetPlayerJob()
print('Job:', jobName, jobLabel)
clientFunctions.note: Deprecated - Use GetPlayerJobData() for better structure

clientFunctions.name: GetPlayerJobData
clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
local jobData = Bridge.Framework.GetPlayerJobData()
print('Job:', jobData.jobName)
print('On duty:', jobData.onDuty)
print('Is boss:', jobData.boss)

clientFunctions.name: HasItem
clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
if Bridge.Framework.HasItem('phone') then
    print('Player has a phone')
end

clientFunctions.name: GetPlayerInventory
clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
local inventory = Bridge.Framework.GetPlayerInventory()
for _, item in pairs(inventory) do
    print('Item:', item.name, 'Count:', item.count)
end

clientFunctions.name: GetItemInfo
clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
local itemInfo = Bridge.Framework.GetItemInfo('phone')
print('Item label:', itemInfo.label)
print('Item weight:', itemInfo.weight)

clientFunctions.name: GetVehicleProperties
clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
local vehicle = GetVehiclePedIsIn(PlayerPedId(), false)
local props = Bridge.Framework.GetVehicleProperties(vehicle)
print('Plate:', props.plate)

clientFunctions.name: SetVehicleProperties
clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
local vehicle = GetVehiclePedIsIn(PlayerPedId(), false)
local props = { plate = 'BRIDGE1' }
Bridge.Framework.SetVehicleProperties(vehicle, props)

clientFunctions.name: GetIsPlayerDead
clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
if Bridge.Framework.GetIsPlayerDead() then
    print('Player is down or dead')
end

clientFunctions.name: Notify
clientFunctions.note: Consider using Bridge.Notify module for better notification handling

clientFunctions.name: ShowHelpText
clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
Bridge.Framework.ShowHelpText('Press E to interact', 'top-center')
clientFunctions.note: Consider using Bridge.HelpText module for better text UI handling

serverFunctions.name: GetFrameworkName

returns.description: The name of the detected framework

serverFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
local frameworkName = Bridge.Framework.GetFrameworkName()
print('Server using:', frameworkName)

serverFunctions.name: GetIsFrameworkAdmin

returns.description: Whether the player is an admin

serverFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
if Bridge.Framework.GetIsFrameworkAdmin(source) then
    print('Player is an admin')
end

serverFunctions.name: GetPlayer

returns.description: Player object in framework's native format

serverFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
local player = Bridge.Framework.GetPlayer(source)
if player then
    print('Found player data')
end
serverFunctions.note: Returns raw framework player object - prefer using specific getter functions

serverFunctions.name: GetFrameworkJobs
serverFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
local jobs = Bridge.Framework.GetFrameworkJobs()
print('Total jobs:', #jobs)

serverFunctions.name: GetPlayers

returns.description: Array of all online player source IDs

serverFunctions.example:

serverFunctions.name: GetItem
serverFunctions.example:

serverFunctions.name: GetPlayerJobData
serverFunctions.example:

serverFunctions.example:

serverFunctions.name: SetMetadata
GetOwnedVehicles

returns.description: Array of owned vehicles with vehicle and plate

serverFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
local vehicles = Bridge.Framework.GetOwnedVehicles(source)
for _, vehicle in pairs(vehicles) do
    print('Vehicle:', vehicle.vehicle, 'Plate:', vehicle.plate)
end

serverFunctions.name: RegisterUsableItem

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Function to call when item is used

serverFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()
Bridge.Framework.RegisterUsableItem('phone', function(src, itemData)
    print('Player', src, 'used phone')
end)
